title: Articles from Romain Clement
description: I mostly write about software engineering for cloud-native applications. And some other stuff.

items.content_html: When activating Sentry crash reporting in JavaScript/TypeScript client-side code, the default mechanism sends captures and send the current URL, including any URL fragments. This can pose a privacy issue when dealing with client-side end-to-end encrypted applications.
items.title: Scrubbing URL fragments from Sentry crash reports
items.summary: When activating Sentry crash reporting in JavaScript/TypeScript client-side code, the default mechanism sends captures and send the current URL, including any URL fragments. This can pose a privacy issue when dealing with client-side end-to-end encrypted applications.

items.content_html: The current state of GitHub Actions is promising but still has some rough edges, when it comes to configuring complete GitOps CI/CD workflows. But I've managed to find some tricks to get the job done.
items.title: GitOps CI/CD workflows with GitHub Actions
items.summary: The current state of GitHub Actions is promising but still has some rough edges, when it comes to configuring complete GitOps CI/CD workflows. But I've managed to find some tricks to get the job done.
